t: FE/UX core agent Teammate API sections

xd.r: Teammate API lifecycle patterns referenced by all agent sections
Pattern reference for Lead Teammate API team lifecycle section
Pattern reference for Dev Teammate API SendMessage section

tr: Every FE/UX agent Teammate API section is wrapped in conditional: active ONLY when team_mode=teammate
FE Lead gets spawnTeam yolo-frontend lifecycle, UX Lead gets spawnTeam yolo-uiux lifecycle
FE/UX Senior/Dev/Architect SendMessage patterns mirror backend counterparts with dept-specific targets

ar.c: section with spawnTeam yolo-frontend team lifecycle
section with SendMessage review patterns to FE Lead
section with SendMessage dev_progress/dev_blocker to FE Senior
section with SendMessage architecture_design to FE Lead
section with spawnTeam yolo-uiux team lifecycle
section with SendMessage review patterns to UX Lead
section with SendMessage dev_progress/dev_blocker to UX Senior
section with SendMessage architecture_design to UX Lead

obj: Add Teammate API conditional sections to all 8 FE/UX core agents (fe-lead, fe-senior, fe-dev, fe-architect, ux-lead, ux-senior, ux-dev, ux-architect) following Phase 1 patterns for backend counterparts. Resolves C1 critical finding.

a: Add Teammate API team lifecycle section to agents/yolo-fe-lead.md. Follow yolo-lead.md pattern exactly: spawnTeam with name yolo-frontend, register teammates (fe-architect, fe-senior, fe-dev, then on-demand: fe-tester at step 5, fe-qa/fe-qa-code at step 8), shutdown protocol, cleanup. Guard with 'active ONLY when team_mode=teammate'. Reference @references/teammate-api-patterns.md.
v: File contains ## Teammate API section with spawnTeam yolo-frontend
done: FE Lead Teammate API section added, committed
spec:
INSERT new '## Teammate API (when team_mode=teammate)' section in agents/yolo-fe-lead.md BETWEEN the existing '## Constraints & Effort' section (line 82) and the '## Context' section (line 84). The section must be an EXACT structural mirror of agents/yolo-lead.md lines 87-114, with these department-specific substitutions:

1. CONDITIONAL GUARD (blockquote, first line after heading):
   > This section is active ONLY when team_mode=teammate. When team_mode=task (default), ignore this section entirely and use Task tool for all agent spawning.

2. REFERENCE LINK (line after guard):
   Full patterns: @references/teammate-api-patterns.md

3. SUBSECTION '### Team Lifecycle' with exactly 5 numbered steps:
   Step 1 - Create team: spawnTeam with name `yolo-frontend` (NOT yolo-backend). Description: `Frontend engineering team for phase {N}: {phase-name}`.
   Step 2 - Register teammates: Register in order: fe-architect (if Step 2), fe-senior (Step 4/7), fe-dev (Step 6). On-demand registration: fe-tester at step 5, fe-qa/fe-qa-code at step 8. Each teammate receives only their scoped context (see Context Scoping Protocol in execute-protocol.md).
   Step 3 - Coordinate via SendMessage: Replace Task tool spawn+wait with SendMessage to registered teammates. Receive results via SendMessage responses. Schemas: see references/handoff-schemas.md.
   Step 4 - Shutdown: When phase completes (Step 10) or on error, send `shutdown_request` to all teammates. Wait for `shutdown_response` from each (30s timeout). Verify all artifacts committed.
   Step 5 - Cleanup: After shutdown responses received, verify git status clean for team files. Log any incomplete work in deviations.

4. SUBSECTION '### Unchanged Behavior' with exactly 4 bullet points:
   - Escalation chain: FE Dev -> FE Senior -> FE Lead -> FE Architect (unchanged)
   - Artifact formats: All JSONL schemas remain identical
   - Context isolation: Each teammate receives only their scoped context
   - Commit protocol: One commit per task, one commit per artifact (unchanged)

CRITICAL DIFFERENCES FROM BACKEND:
- Team name: `yolo-frontend` (not `yolo-backend`)
- Description prefix: `Frontend` (not `Backend`)
- Teammate names: fe-architect, fe-senior, fe-dev, fe-tester, fe-qa, fe-qa-code (all with fe- prefix)
- Escalation chain uses FE prefixed roles
- On-demand registration: fe-tester at step 5, fe-qa/fe-qa-code at step 8 (matches architecture.toon C7 resolution)
- NO security agent in FE team (security is backend-only, registered at step 9 in backend team only)

DO NOT modify any other section of the file. The existing Context table at the end of the file stays as-is.

a: Add Teammate API SendMessage sections to agents/yolo-fe-senior.md and agents/yolo-fe-dev.md. FE Senior: receive escalations from FE Dev (dev_blocker), send review results (senior_spec, code_review_result) to FE Lead, send review changes to FE Dev. FE Dev: send dev_progress/dev_blocker to FE Senior. Follow yolo-senior.md and yolo-dev.md patterns with FE dept targets.
v: Both files contain ## Teammate API section with SendMessage schemas
done: FE Senior + FE Dev Teammate API sections added, committed
spec:
TWO FILES to modify in this task.

--- FILE 1: agents/yolo-fe-senior.md ---

INSERT new '## Teammate API (when team_mode=teammate)' section BETWEEN '## Constraints & Effort' (line 88) and '## Context' (line 90). Mirror agents/yolo-senior.md lines 83-133 with FE-specific substitutions:

1. CONDITIONAL GUARD (blockquote):
   > This section is active ONLY when team_mode=teammate. When team_mode=task (default), ignore this section entirely.

2. REFERENCE LINK:
   Full patterns: @references/teammate-api-patterns.md

3. SUBSECTION '### Communication via SendMessage' with exactly 4 sub-blocks:

   **Receive from FE Dev:** Listen for `dev_progress` (task completion) and `dev_blocker` (escalation) messages from FE Dev teammates. Respond to blockers with clarification or `code_review_changes` instructions.

   **Send to FE Lead (Design Review):** After enriching plan specs, send `senior_spec` schema to FE Lead:
   ```json
   {
     "type": "senior_spec",
     "plan_id": "{plan_id}",
     "tasks_enriched": 3,
     "concerns": [],
     "committed": true
   }
   ```

   **Send to FE Lead (Code Review):** After reviewing code, send `code_review_result` schema to FE Lead:
   ```json
   {
     "type": "code_review_result",
     "plan_id": "{plan_id}",
     "result": "approve",
     "cycle": 1,
     "findings_count": 0,
     "critical": 0,
     "artifact": "phases/{phase}/code-review.jsonl",
     "committed": true
   }
   ```

   **Send to FE Dev (Changes Requested):** When code review requests changes, send `code_review_changes` directly to FE Dev's teammate ID instead of spawning a new Task.

4. SUBSECTION '### Unchanged Behavior' with exactly 4 bullets:
   - Escalation target: FE Lead (unchanged)
   - Design review and code review protocols unchanged
   - Artifact formats (enriched plan.jsonl, code-review.jsonl) unchanged
   - Decision logging unchanged

CRITICAL DIFFERENCES FROM BACKEND SENIOR:
- All references to 'Dev' become 'FE Dev'
- All references to 'Lead' become 'FE Lead'
- Escalation target: FE Lead (not Lead)

--- FILE 2: agents/yolo-fe-dev.md ---

INSERT new '## Teammate API (when team_mode=teammate)' section BETWEEN '## Constraints & Effort' (line 72) and '## Context' (line 74). Mirror agents/yolo-dev.md lines 81-127 with FE-specific substitutions:

1. CONDITIONAL GUARD (blockquote):
   > This section is active ONLY when team_mode=teammate. When team_mode=task (default), ignore this section entirely. Use Task tool result returns and file-based artifacts instead.

2. REFERENCE LINK:
   Full patterns: @references/teammate-api-patterns.md

3. SUBSECTION '### Communication via SendMessage' with exactly 3 sub-blocks:

   Replace Task tool result returns with direct SendMessage to FE Senior's teammate ID:

   **Progress reporting (per task):** Send `dev_progress` schema to FE Senior after each task commit:
   ```json
   {
     "type": "dev_progress",
     "task": "{plan_id}/T{N}",
     "plan_id": "{plan_id}",
     "commit": "{hash}",
     "status": "complete",
     "concerns": []
   }
   ```

   **Blocker escalation:** Send `dev_blocker` schema to FE Senior when blocked:
   ```json
   {
     "type": "dev_blocker",
     "task": "{plan_id}/T{N}",
     "plan_id": "{plan_id}",
     "blocker": "{description}",
     "needs": "{what is needed}",
     "attempted": ["{what was tried}"]
   }
   ```

   **Receive instructions:** Listen for `code_review_changes` from FE Senior with exact fix instructions. Follow precisely (unchanged from task mode behavior).

4. SUBSECTION '### Unchanged Behavior' with exactly 4 bullets:
   - Escalation target: FE Senior ONLY (never FE Lead or FE Architect)
   - One commit per task, stage files individually
   - TDD RED/GREEN protocol unchanged
   - Summary.jsonl production unchanged

CRITICAL DIFFERENCES FROM BACKEND DEV:
- All references to 'Senior' become 'FE Senior'
- All references to 'Lead' become 'FE Lead'
- All references to 'Architect' become 'FE Architect'
- Escalation target: FE Senior ONLY (never FE Lead or FE Architect)

DO NOT modify any other sections of either file.

a: Add Teammate API section to agents/yolo-fe-architect.md. SendMessage architecture_design schema to FE Lead. Follow yolo-architect.md pattern with FE dept targets. Guard with team_mode=teammate conditional.
v: File contains ## Teammate API section with SendMessage architecture_design
done: FE Architect Teammate API section added, committed
spec:
INSERT new '## Teammate API (when team_mode=teammate)' section in agents/yolo-fe-architect.md BETWEEN '## Constraints & Effort' (line 68) and '## Context' (line 70). Mirror agents/yolo-architect.md lines 71-99 with FE-specific substitutions:

1. CONDITIONAL GUARD (blockquote):
   > This section is active ONLY when team_mode=teammate. When team_mode=task (default), ignore this section entirely.

2. REFERENCE LINK:
   Full patterns: @references/teammate-api-patterns.md

3. SUBSECTION '### Communication via SendMessage' with exactly 2 sub-blocks:

   **Send to FE Lead (Architecture):** After completing frontend architecture design, send `architecture_design` schema to FE Lead:
   ```json
   {
     "type": "architecture_design",
     "phase": "{N}",
     "artifact": "phases/{phase}/fe-architecture.toon",
     "decisions": [{"decision": "...", "rationale": "...", "alternatives": []}],
     "risks": [{"risk": "...", "impact": "high", "mitigation": "..."}],
     "committed": true
   }
   ```

   **Receive from FE Lead:** Listen for escalation messages from FE Lead when FE Senior or FE Dev encounter design-level issues. Respond with architecture decisions via SendMessage.

4. SUBSECTION '### Unchanged Behavior' with exactly 4 bullets:
   - Escalation target: Owner via FE Lead orchestration (unchanged)
   - fe-architecture.toon format unchanged
   - Decision logging unchanged
   - Read-only constraints unchanged (no Edit tool, no Bash)

CRITICAL DIFFERENCES FROM BACKEND ARCHITECT:
- All references to 'Lead' become 'FE Lead'
- All references to 'Senior' become 'FE Senior'
- All references to 'Dev' become 'FE Dev'
- Artifact path: `phases/{phase}/fe-architecture.toon` (not `phases/{phase}/architecture.toon`)
- Escalation target: Owner via FE Lead orchestration (not User via Lead orchestration -- FE Architect escalates through Owner per FE hierarchy)

DO NOT modify any other sections of the file.

a: Add Teammate API team lifecycle section to agents/yolo-ux-lead.md. Follow yolo-lead.md pattern: spawnTeam with name yolo-uiux, register teammates (ux-architect, ux-senior, ux-dev, then on-demand: ux-tester at step 5, ux-qa/ux-qa-code at step 8), shutdown protocol, cleanup. Guard with team_mode=teammate.

done: UX Lead Teammate API section added, committed
spec:
INSERT new '## Teammate API (when team_mode=teammate)' section in agents/yolo-ux-lead.md BETWEEN '## Constraints & Effort' (line 76) and '## Context' (line 78). Mirror agents/yolo-lead.md lines 87-114 with UX-specific substitutions:

1. CONDITIONAL GUARD (blockquote):
   > This section is active ONLY when team_mode=teammate. When team_mode=task (default), ignore this section entirely and use Task tool for all agent spawning.

2. REFERENCE LINK:
   Full patterns: @references/teammate-api-patterns.md

3. SUBSECTION '### Team Lifecycle' with exactly 5 numbered steps:
   Step 1 - Create team: spawnTeam with name `yolo-uiux` (NOT yolo-backend, NOT yolo-frontend). Description: `UI/UX design team for phase {N}: {phase-name}`.
   Step 2 - Register teammates: Register in order: ux-architect (if Step 2), ux-senior (Step 4/7), ux-dev (Step 6). On-demand registration: ux-tester at step 5, ux-qa/ux-qa-code at step 8. Each teammate receives only their scoped context (see Context Scoping Protocol in execute-protocol.md).
   Step 3 - Coordinate via SendMessage: Replace Task tool spawn+wait with SendMessage to registered teammates. Receive results via SendMessage responses. Schemas: see references/handoff-schemas.md.
   Step 4 - Shutdown: When phase completes (Step 10) or on error, send `shutdown_request` to all teammates. Wait for `shutdown_response` from each (30s timeout). Verify all artifacts committed.
   Step 5 - Cleanup: After shutdown responses received, verify git status clean for team files. Log any incomplete work in deviations.

4. SUBSECTION '### Unchanged Behavior' with exactly 4 bullet points:
   - Escalation chain: UX Dev -> UX Senior -> UX Lead -> UX Architect (unchanged)
   - Artifact formats: All JSONL schemas remain identical
   - Context isolation: Each teammate receives only their scoped context
   - Commit protocol: One commit per task, one commit per artifact (unchanged)

CRITICAL DIFFERENCES FROM BACKEND AND FE:
- Team name: `yolo-uiux` (not `yolo-backend` or `yolo-frontend`)
- Description prefix: `UI/UX design` (not `Backend engineering` or `Frontend engineering`)
- Teammate names: ux-architect, ux-senior, ux-dev, ux-tester, ux-qa, ux-qa-code (all with ux- prefix)
- Escalation chain uses UX prefixed roles
- On-demand registration: ux-tester at step 5, ux-qa/ux-qa-code at step 8 (same step boundaries as FE, per C7 resolution)
- NO security agent in UX team (security is backend-only)

DO NOT modify any other section of the file.

a: Add Teammate API SendMessage sections to agents/yolo-ux-senior.md and agents/yolo-ux-dev.md. Follow same patterns as T2 with UX department targets. UX Senior: receive escalations from UX Dev, send review results to UX Lead. UX Dev: send dev_progress/dev_blocker to UX Senior.
v: Both files contain ## Teammate API section with SendMessage schemas
done: UX Senior + UX Dev Teammate API sections added, committed

--- FILE 1: agents/yolo-ux-senior.md ---

- All references to 'Lead' become 'UX Lead'

INSERT new '## Teammate API (when team_mode=teammate)' section BETWEEN '## Constraints & Effort' (line 81) and '## Context' (line 83). Mirror agents/yolo-dev.md lines 81-127 with UX-specific substitutions:

   **Progress reporting (per task):** Send `dev_progress` schema to UX Senior after each task commit:

   **Receive instructions:** Listen for `code_review_changes` from UX Senior with exact fix instructions. Follow precisely (unchanged from task mode behavior).

   - One commit per task, stage files individually

INSERT new '## Teammate API (when team_mode=teammate)' section in agents/yolo-ux-architect.md BETWEEN '## Constraints & Effort' (line 58) and '## Context' (line 60). Mirror agents/yolo-architect.md lines 71-99 with UX-specific substitutions:

1. CONDITIONAL GUARD (blockquote):
   > This section is active ONLY when team_mode=teammate. When team_mode=task (default), ignore this section entirely.

2. REFERENCE LINK:
   Full patterns: @references/teammate-api-patterns.md

3. SUBSECTION '### Communication via SendMessage' with exactly 2 sub-blocks:

   **Send to UX Lead (Architecture):** After completing UX architecture design, send `architecture_design` schema to UX Lead:
   ```json
   {
     "type": "architecture_design",
     "phase": "{N}",
     "artifact": "phases/{phase}/ux-architecture.toon",
     "decisions": [{"decision": "...", "rationale": "...", "alternatives": []}],
     "risks": [{"risk": "...", "impact": "high", "mitigation": "..."}],
     "committed": true
   }
   ```

   **Receive from UX Lead:** Listen for escalation messages from UX Lead when UX Senior or UX Dev encounter design-level issues. Respond with architecture decisions via SendMessage.

4. SUBSECTION '### Unchanged Behavior' with exactly 4 bullets:
   - Escalation target: Owner via UX Lead orchestration (unchanged)
   - ux-architecture.toon format unchanged
   - Decision logging unchanged
   - Read-only constraints unchanged (no Edit tool, no Bash)

CRITICAL DIFFERENCES FROM BACKEND ARCHITECT:
- All references to 'Lead' become 'UX Lead'
- All references to 'Senior' become 'UX Senior'
- All references to 'Dev' become 'UX Dev'
- Artifact path: `phases/{phase}/ux-architecture.toon` (not `phases/{phase}/architecture.toon`)
- Architecture doc name: ux-architecture.toon (not architecture.toon or fe-architecture.toon)
- Escalation target: Owner via UX Lead orchestration (UX Architect escalates through Owner per UX hierarchy)

DO NOT modify any other sections of the file.
